title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, goes on an unexpected adventure. This classic fantasy introduces Middle-earth and its legendary characters.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling depiction of a totalitarian regime and constant surveillance. Orwell's dystopia is both a political warning and literary masterpiece.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Scout Finch navigates childhood in a racially divided town. The story explores morality, empathy, and justice.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Jay Gatsby's obsession with Daisy Buchanan drives a tale of wealth and illusion. Fitzgerald critiques the American Dream with elegance and style.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, family, and social expectations. Austen's wit and insight make this a timeless romantic classic.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Ishmael joins Captain Ahab's obsessive pursuit of the white whale in a tale of fate and the sea.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A genetically engineered society promises happiness at the cost of individuality and freedom.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Raskolnikov grapples with guilt and morality after committing a murder he believes justified.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tempestuous tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: In a future where books burn, one fireman seeks truth and rebellion.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Frodo begins a perilous journey to destroy the One Ring, gathering allies in Middle-earth.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Fellowship is broken, yet the quest continues amid wars and the rise of dark powers.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The final battles for Middle-earth culminate as Frodo nears Mount Doom.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphan’s journey to independence, love, and moral integrity.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: The Joad family migrates west amid Dust Bowl hardship and hope.
